Column Comment.0: APPLICATION ID: Unique identifier for applications you make for continuations,licenses etc. to the government.
Column Comment.1: APPLICATION BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: This columnis used to capture informationabout who was involved in an application.
Column Comment.2: APPLICATION BUSINESS ASSOCIATE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A seqenceradded to allow a business associate to have more than one role with an application.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: APPLICATION BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ROLE: This table is used to captureinformation about the role that a business associate played in the application(approver, creator, reviewer etc.).
Column Comment.5: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the business associate who is the contact forthis application Business Associate (usually a regulator, company or organization)
Column Comment.6: DESCRIPTION: description of the business associate who has this role, the handlingof the role, type of activities required etc.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
